campaign.story:
Stretch Goals:  
 JOIN ME ON A JOURNEY TO FIND THE TRUTH:
My name is Elijah. I believe miracles can happen. Also, I have a degree in philosophy as well as psychology, so when I hear claims of people being healed, I naturally have lots of questions. I'm convinced that if they're true, and God is doing this, then there should be a trail of evidence that corroborates some of those stories. 
So I am going on an incredible journey to search for this evidence. Along the way we will talk to people from all walks of life, and pose hard philosophical, scientific, and theological questions to see if we find cases that we think are the real deal. Then we will give you the best testimonies we can find and the evidence to decide for yourself.
INTERVIEWS FROM:
and many others…
WHAT YOU MAY NOT KNOW:
I have always had a passion to know God and have incredible experiences. At the same time, I know that it’s very easy for humans to see what they want to see. In my pursuit of reality, I have wrestled with the hard questions, such as:
“If miracles are happening, where is the medical documentation?"
"What do you do with natural phenomena like the placebo effect, or psychosomatic disorders that mimic miracles?”
"How can I know God is really doing this, and not my imagination?”
So to seek reality and be intellectually honest, I will research what both skeptics and believers are saying.
A FIRST ATTEMPT:
My first effort was to start a website in November 2014 and see if I could collect testimonies. From here maybe there would be something to build a documentary on. Honestly, there were only a few hits, so I wasn’t really sure it was something to go after. I was feeling like it was going nowhere and was about to let it all go.
AND SUDDENLY:
One day while at home I received a text from friends. They were listening to a prophetic speaker named Shawn Bolz who was currently in town. Shawn was speaking to a large crowd at my local church and called out my name, so I rushed there. In front of 600 people, I recorded what he said on my iPhone.
NOW:
What would you do if a man you have never met tells you your name, birthday, home town, wife’s name, wife’s occupation and even family members' names? Well, I chose to listen. He continued to tell me that God is aware of this idea for the film and to make the film!
From that moment forward, I have found myself on a radical journey. Testimonies have been flowing in. I have met doctors testifying to miracles they saw, and pastors who are pointing me to the right type of case for what I hope to film. I have started working with medical researchers who are providing great feedback on what works and what does not. God has brought an incredible film team into my life and momentum is gaining. It has been a risk for my wife and I. We have already put $17,000 into making this film. 
Shawn Bolz
WHY MAKE A FILM LIKE THIS?
People have deep questions, and there are answers. 
Film is one of the best ways to see rapid cultural transformation in the church and society. 
The influencers of our day speak the language of science, reason, evidence, and logic, not just experience and the Bible. Talking about the supernatural without speaking in the language of culture is like speaking a foreign language. 
We want to create a fertile path for the kingdom of God to influence the realms of science, academia, and medicine. 
This is an opportunity to present the world with medically verified healings and legitimize the supernatural. 
Finally, I believe from the message above, the Spirit of God has made clear that I should do this film.
PLAY

THE RISKS WE WILL TAKE:
We will examine the hard philosophical, theological, and scientific issues concerning miracles. 
We will not only interview theologians, but scientists, philosophers, researchers that are skeptics and believers. 
We will seek medical documentation. 
We will film doctors who pray and report miracles. 
We will partner with the Spirit, and go where He leads.
BENEFITS TO YOU:
Partnering with God: With such clarity, we expect God to do something huge. Wouldn’t it be cool to be a part of this amazing documentary? You can. If you will give, I will go. I need your help. I can't do this without you. Let's partner with God together.
Getting Informed: Have you ever wanted to see a miracle corroborated by medical documentation? Do you have questions like, “How do I tell a miracle apart from a natural phenomenon? What about the placebo effect, psychosomatic disorders, or Munchausen syndrome?” Do you know how to respond when people ask hard questions? A film like this can help expand your awareness and knowledge.
Examining Medical Reports
Help Others: Do you know a deep thinker, scientist, or medical professional with questions about miracles? A film like would be a great benefit for an open minded person. The world needs this very badly. Some people aren’t convinced and it’s not always their fault. While miracles happen, the evidence is often lacking. It's actually quite easy for someone to get the impression that all of this is just wishful thinking. Even a person who WANTS to experience the miraculous can often struggle with this. This doesn't have to be the case. 
Transform Society: Imagine the people who will be inspired to get prayer for their illnesses, and see God move in their lives. Imagine, the people who will come to Jesus. Imagine the doctors who will watch something like this and be inspired to pray for their patients. Imagine the professors who would be empowered to teach on this topic!
PLAY

Our Costs:
Research: $5,000
Collecting Data | Fact Checking | Expert Opinions | Further Testing
Pre Production: $9500
Web | Legal | Accounting | Script | Directing | Coaching | Insurance 
High Quality Video Production: $36,000
Equipment | Crew | Airfare | Lodging | Ground Transportation | Food | Reimbursement 
Post Production: $37,000
Editing | Color | Graphics | Verification | Audio | Titling 
Misc: $29,000
Reward Fulfillment | Kickstarter Fees | Buffer | Other
PLAY

Pray
Pray about the lives that will be touched.  Pray that the finances will come in, and that God will give us amazing cases to film.
Share
Every time you share someone new gets to see the vision for the film. They get excited. If you believe in this so will others. People need to see things six or seven times before they respond, so keep sharing.  If you know a blogger, podcaster, leader, radio, or Tv host who might like to know about this then please forward this link.
Pledge
If you pledge a few dollars it can go along way. Every dollar you pledge is voicing your support for seeing the intellectual and the supernatural come together. 
PLAY
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Finding the Right Testimonies Will Take an Unpredictable Amount of Time:

We are still researching cases expecting the Lord to provide. Some people will not want to be on film. Others will not have the right type of before and after evidence. Some medical professionals will not want to be filmed because they fear the response of the insurance companies or medical boards. Every researcher I have talked with has said this is very difficult. That’s okay. God has a plan, and we will work on His timetable. We will keep all backers updated. 

Higher than Expected Costs:

Because we don’t know quite yet the exact testimonies we will use, we can’t project the cost of testing, or travel expenses. We've done our homework, but will let you know if something comes up.

Bad Data:

A film like this may attract people who want to see if they can get one by us in order to become famous or to discredit the work. I am surrounding myself with theologians, philosophers, researchers, scientists and medical professionals. We will do our best to fact check every testimony, and strive for intellectual honesty.

Ensuring We Honor Those Involved: 

I deeply care that every person we film and encounter are treated with respect and love. We will take extra efforts to make that a reality especially with those in the film who may disagree with us.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
There is a saying that I have come to believe is true.
“God doesn’t often call the equipped, but equips the called.”
When I began this project, I knew next to nothing about film, and researching miracle claims.
Where would I even begin to find them?

I wanted to update you all on the progress of the documentary. As you all know this has been a journey, as this is my first film. I thank you for your support. Covid-19 has created huge issues, and it slowed things down. Right now, I am in the legal stage…this is where all the B-roll is being tested for the Fair Use Act, so order that we can hopefully get E and O insurance. We are also working on the DVD covers right now as well. 
Thanks,

I hope that all is well, and that everyone is washing their hands. Our last case just got published in a peer reviewed journal, so we are in the final phase. We are so excited…
The film is looking amazing. I talked with a very well-known filmmaker about our last draft and he said it was one of the “best Christian films he has ever seen.”

We just got a fine cut recently. I showed it to a few people, and it blew their minds. We are doing a final round of brief edits, and then on to coloring and sound. Trust me this one is well worth the wait.

Dear Kickstarter Family,
 I hope all is well. I saw a rough cut of the first 20 minutes of the film, and my mind was blown. As far as Christian movies go, I have not seen one that looks and feels this compelling. In order to get us over this last hump, we have brought on some new team members. 
David and Morgan Hansow

We have been working on the film nonstop since our last update. However, we are in an organization stage, which is really boring to write about. Basically, one must label every file, mark the clips, put then in bins by topic. We had to switch editing softward from Final Cut to Premiere Pro, which took months. This is a project that has never been accomplished before so there are unforeseen setbacks, but it in God’s timing. We send a first draft to an expert storyteller in San Diego. He gave a list of scene to alter and some to reshot. God is helping me make connections with experts who can take this to the next level. I thank you all for you patience. It’s coming and is going to be great.

Mice and Dice is a FAMILY FRIENDLY game that can be enjoyed by people of ALL ages! This game is perfect for children. It is easy to learn. Quick to play, and makes counting and learning numbers fun and exciting!
  IF KICKSTARTER GOAL IS REACHED:
 IF ALL GROWTH GOALS ARE REACHED:
 First and foremost, the money raised will be used to pay our illustrator to create original art/design for Mice & Dice This will cost around $5,000 total. Our illustrator is the wonderfully talented: Lauren Scott. Please find her website and biography in the link below:
http://www.lauren-scott.co.uk/
BELOW IS A TASTE OF HER INCREDIBLE WORK FOR THE GAME SO FAR!!!!
 Michael and Stephen created and designed this game with kids and families in mind. When they were growing up they used to play games like Candyland and Mouse Trap with their mom. Once they matured they became baby-sitters for family friends, and, from there, graduated to camp counselors.  (Stephen was also a teacher for several years, and still works with kids in his local church to this day) 
They believe that they remained kids at heart because of this. Today, they have noticed that children are much more inclined to pick up an iPad or play a video game then they are to play a board game. While they have nothing against either of those means of entertainment, they know that board games bring with them a whole other element of quality time and community where modern technology falls short. So, one of the core mechanics of the game is that it is "Your turn, every turn." The purpose of this mechanic is to keep children (and adults for that matter) engaged and focused throughout the entirety of the game!
After, years of development, play-testing, and polishing they are finally ready to bring Mice & Dice to families everywhere....with your help of course!
This week is RAT WEEK!
 The Rat Card that we need a name for is:
"If you do not roll YOUR number on YOUR turn, lose a Mouse Card (active or inactive)"
BELOW IS OUR HOW TO PLAY VIDEO. PLEASE NOTE EVERY COMPONENT IN THIS VIDEO IS FROM OUR PROTOTYPE. THE ACTUAL PUBLISHED GAME WILL LOOK EVEN BETTER ;)
Mice and Dice RULES
Objective:  The first player to Cheeseville (move 50 spaces) WINS!
Game Pieces: 
6 Dice
6 Point Markers
6 Number Cards
19 Mice Cards
20 Rat Cards
15 Cheese Cards
1 Game Board
Start of the Game:  Arrange the Rat, Mice, and Cheese cards in their own piles on the game board.  Before the game starts, each player takes a turn rolling one die.  The number rolled is that player’s number for the game.  No two players can have the same number and some numbers may be inactive for the game.  The player who most recently ate cheese goes first.
Game Play: At the start of their turn a player may play any Rat, Mouse, or Cheese Cards they may have.  Unless otherwise noted, all Mouse and Rat cards stay in play until removed by a player.  The player then rolls their die/dice.  Each non-rolling player moves one (1) space for each of their numbers rolled and the rolling player moves two (2) spaces for each of their numbers rolled.  If a player’s number appears more than once in a roll, for EACH number rolled beyond the first that player may either: (1) Draw a Rat OR Mouse card; OR (2) Remove a Rat card played on them; OR (3) Draw a Cheese card IF the player has moved at least 25 spaces and is in the “Cheese Phase”.  A player may do any combination of the three choices if their number is rolled more than once in a roll.  Once all cards are drawn and each player gets their points, game play continues to the left.
Note: A player may only have one “active” Mouse and/or Cheese card at a time. A player can have multiple Rat cards played “on” them at a time.
Rat Cards:  Play Rat cards “on” an opponent, in which case the effect hurts that player.
Dirty Rat: Move 1 space instead of 2 when you roll your number.
Lab Rat: Lose all of your un-played Rat cards.
Rat in the Hat: You cannot move if your number is rolled by other players.
Sewer Rat: Go back 5 spaces.
Fat Rat: Roll 1 less die.
Alley Rat: Steal a revealed Cheese card.
Pack Rat: Steal a Mouse card from a player.                                 
Rat Attack: Shuffle all Mice cards back in the deck.
Mice Cards:  Play Mice cards to help you.
Three Blind Mice: On your roll when you roll 3’s you get move 2 spaces.
Mice on Ice: Move 1 space if you DON’T roll your number.
Mighty Mouse: If you roll your number, pick up a cheese card.  (In addition to other draws, must be above 25 points to “activate” the cheese card)
House Mouse: Move 2 spaces if another player rolls your number.
Nice Mice: Move 3 spaces if you roll your number.
Dice Mice: Roll an extra die (up to a max of 6).
Twice Mice: Roll twice on your turn(s).
Mouse Trap: If a player gives you a Rat card, reveal this card and they must play it on themselves.
Cheese Cards: Once a player moves twenty-five (25) spaces, a player may begin to collect Cheese cards.  Players collect Cheese cards face down and may reveal them only once they want to try and gain those points.  Cheese cards display a point value.  Once the card is revealed, that player must roll two (2) or more of that number (the point value) to gain those points.  Once the points are earned, the Cheese card is placed on the bottom of the Cheese card pile.
Cheddar Cheese: Move 2 Spaces
American Cheese: Move 3 Spaces
Swiss Cheese: Move 4 Spaces
Romano Cheese: Move 5 Spaces
